alert.note: Alert for Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 11 at 7:40PM PDT until June 14 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Washington...Oregon... Grande Ronde River at Troy affecting Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties, Wallowa County and Northeast Blue Mountains zones. .River levels on the Grande Ronde at Troy have been steadily rising over the past 18 hours owing to recent rain and excessive runoff. Additional rainfall is expected tomorrow and tomorrow night from showers and isolated thunderstorms. 24-hour amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are forecast. Minor flooding is possible by tomorrow afternoon. For the Grande Ronde River...Troy...flooding is possible. Fld Observed Forecasts (5 pm PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Grande Ronde River Troy 10.0 9.0 Sat 7 pm PDT 10.0 10.7 9.9 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pdt. ORZ050-WAZ031-032-121045- /O.EXT.KPDT.FL.A.0004.220612T2100Z-220615T0130Z/ /TRYO3.0.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.UU/ 740 PM PDT Sat Jun 11 2022 ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Grande Ronde River at Troy. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding of fields adjacent to the river from Elgin through Troy and downstream to the confluence of the Snake River. At 11.0 feet, Extensive flooding of fields around Troy are possible, but no residences are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM PDT Saturday the stage was 9.0 feet. - The river is expected to steadily rise over the next 24 hours. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
